text: Darryl Norman Johnson (1938 â€“ June 24, 2018) was an American politician and career Foreign Service Officer. He was the United States Ambassador to Lithuania from 1992 to 1994 and United States Ambassador to Thailand from 2001 to 2004. He was a lecturer at his undergraduate alma mater, the University of Washington, where he taught in its Jackson School of International Studies. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:Educators from Chicago Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Politicians from Seattle Category:Educators from Seattle
title: Darryl N. Johnson
